body:

- VS Code Version: 
Version: 1.78.2
Commit: b3e4e68a0bc097f0ae7907b217c1119af9e03435
Date: 2023-05-10T15:00:40.428Z
Electron: 22.5.2
Chromium: 108.0.5359.215
Node.js: 16.17.1
V8: 10.8.168.25-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 22.4.0
Sandboxed: Yes

- OS Version: macOS Ventura 13.3.1 (a) (22E772610a)

Steps to Reproduce:

0. Disable extensions: `$code --disable-extensions`
1. Enable Inline Suggestions (Editor â€º Inline Suggest)
2. Create JS file with the following contents:
```
const x = ''
console.log(x)
```
3. Delete second occurrence of 'x'  and reinsert 'x'.
4. Hit CMD + ARROW-RIGHT.
Expected: Cursor moves beyond closing ')' to EOL.
Actual: Cursor stays put just after 's'.

Workarounds: 
a) CMD + ARROW-LEFT than CMD + ARROW-RIGHT
b) Disable Inline Suggestions
c) Revert back to VSCode version 1.77.3

Keyboard Shortcuts Troubleshooting:

```
2023-05-31 09:32:22.077 [info] [KeybindingService]: / Soft dispatching keyboard event

2023-05-31 09:32:22.079 [info] [KeybindingService]: \ Keyboard event cannot be dispatched in keydown phase.

2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: | Resolving meta+[ArrowRight]
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: \ From 3 keybinding entries, matched editor.action.inlineSuggest.acceptNextWord, when: inlineSuggestionVisible && !editorReadonly, source: built-in.
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: / Received  keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: ArrowRight, keyCode: 39, key: ArrowRight
2023-05-31 09:32:23.579 [info] [KeybindingService]: | Converted keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: ArrowRight, keyCode: 17 ('RightArrow')
```

title: Empty value in markdown.copyFiles.destination sends the image to the parent directory

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: markdown
labels.description: Markdown support issues

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
Testing #183682

When I set up the `markdown.copyFiles.destination` setting, but leave the value empty, the image goes to the parent directory of the workspace folder, which seems unexpected. I think I would want it to keep the default behavior of going next to the markdown file. Just testing this because settings like this are often confusing so I think it should have good failure modes.

title: Show remote indicator in web when remoteAuthority is set

labels.name: remote
labels.description: Remote system operations issues

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
Now that the web uses resolvers too, I think we want to remove the special handling for the remote indicator label.
When a remoteAuthority is set, use the label formatter for the host name.

As always, web embedders can control the remote indicator by defining the `windowIndicator` property in the embedder API.
If they don't set it, they get the host label defined by our resource label providers.

I checked that this does not impact Codespaces (uses windowIndicator) and github.dev (serverless, no remoteAuthority)

title: `View as a scrollable element` does not display full content

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
### Applies To

- [ ] Notebooks (.ipynb files)
- [X] Interactive Window and\/or Cell Scripts (.py files with \#%% markers)

### What happened?

When rendering large output, I now get the option to `View as a scrollable element` at the bottom of the output in addition to the previous "text editor" view.
However, when selecting this option, the full output is not rendered in the scrollable element. Instead, the ellipsis shown in the truncated view remain. The expected outcome would be that the content shown in the scrollable element would be the full output, not the truncated output.
When changing the setting `"notebook.output.scrolling": true`, the scrollable element is displayed immediately and shows the content as expected.
To reproduce:

```
import requests
requests.get('https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/albums').json()
```

Initial output:
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-jupyter/assets/17130646/1a5cffa9-b1d6-4e3a-a5af-aed20b470f82)


Output after clicking `View as a scrollable element`:
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-jupyter/assets/17130646/b18165fc-7bb9-430d-8036-367bb5652b32)


Output when setting `"notebook.output.scrolling": true`:
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-jupyter/assets/17130646/da001c4c-95c9-4b37-8331-5fdc6d40a146)


### VS Code Version

1.78.2

### Jupyter Extension Version

v2023.4.1011241018

### Jupyter logs


title: terminalResolver.ts should not be under services/configurationResolver.ts

labels.name: debt
labels.description: Code quality issues

labels.name: terminal
labels.description: Integrated terminal issues

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body: We don't want configurationResolver to know about terminal. In general, the word "terminal" should only appear in `workbench/contrib` and `platform/terminal` (and other places that need to know about the pty host)

title: Workspace folder picker entry descriptions are suboptimal for some filesystems

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body: Type: Bug 1. Configure setting `"terminal.integrated.splitCwd": "workspaceRoot"` in order to provide a convenient way of invoking the workspace folder picker by splitting a terminal when in a multiroot workspace. 2. Install the MemFS extension (jrieken.vscode-memfs) from Marketplace. 3. Close any open folder or workspace, then run the `MemFS: Setup Workspace` command. 4. Run `Preferences: Open Workspace Settings (JSON)` 5. Edit this to simulate a multi-root workspace in which the paths of the uris point to the filesystem root of two different authorities: ```json { "folders": [ { "name": "MemFS - Sample 1", "uri": "memfs://1/" }, { "name": "MemFS - Sample 2", "uri": "memfs://2/" } ], "settings": {} } ``` 6. On the Terminal tab on the Panel, use the Split Terminal button. The Workspace folder picker looks like this: ![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/assets/6726799/7a5f6086-c85d-4fa0-b66c-de5dea9b4082) Displaying the folder name twice on each line is unhelpful. When the path of the uri is `/` I propose showing the non-relative label instead. I will submit a PR. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.79.0-insider (f6be5461f8bc69013a605f5baea834651c6589fb, 2023-05-20T01:18:53.811Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.22621 Modes:

<!-- ðŸ”§ Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- ðŸª“ If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- ðŸ“£ Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
Version: 1.78.2 (user setup)
Commit: b3e4e68a0bc097f0ae7907b217c1119af9e03435
Date: 2023-05-10T14:39:26.248Z
Electron: 22.5.2
Chromium: 108.0.5359.215
Node.js: 16.17.1
V8: 10.8.168.25-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.22621
Sandboxed: Yes
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a VB file with the following line:
``` vb
If JobNameLen < 0 Then
```
Observe that the `<` seems to be marked with the mismatched bracket color.
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/assets/26179051/d7e0373d-a4e7-4858-9a07-86c74c0d1220)

instead of line 
![image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/assets/26179051/4250f739-c78e-4318-abca-70f2ec720d01)


Probably the ideal solution is to add an `unbalancedBracketScopes` value of `keyword.operator` to the package.json file.

However, it might also be worth noting that I do not understand why the `<` or `>` are getting this treatment, because I am not observing them being color matched.

title: toggling scrollable output for notebooks just shows the full output

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
1. set `"notebook.output.scrolling": false`
2. run a cell with enough output to truncate scroll

```
for i in range(100):
    print(i)
```

3. click the link to view as a scrollable element
:bug: output height is stretched to show entire output without scrollable region

title: Getting started page awaits a lifecycle phase in `setInput`?

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
(found this because this actually resulted in a error: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/183226)

Code is here:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/bf9be2c3661005357d27b8099c54ec99e559cf31/src/vs/workbench/contrib/welcomeGettingStarted/browser/gettingStarted.ts#L308

I do not fully understand this, but instead of awaiting the phase in `setInput`, why not await it before opening the welcome page? And why does not wait at all there, what is the reason?

I think this may also be the cause of https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/181660

title: EnvironmentVariableMutatorOptions when accessed via get should return default values, not undefined

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: terminal
labels.description: Integrated terminal issues

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
Test here:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/27293f19d28e908fb6971a23ac5414ea8ed3a7f2/extensions/vscode-api-tests/src/singlefolder-tests/terminal.test.ts#L845-L865

It should be expecting:

```js
{
  applyAtProcessCreation: true,
  applyAtShellIntegration: false
}
```
